original: gzhal bya zhes bya'i sgra sogs kyi //
analyzed: gzhal bya zhes bya'i sgra sogs kyi //
translated: And “object of comprehension” and so on.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: as was said,

original: gzhal bya zhes bya'i sgra sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhal bya zhes bya'i sgra sogs pa smos te /
translated: the term “cognizable” and so on,

original: gzhal bya la sogs pa'i sgra'i bsal bar bya ba med do zhes gang la rjod par byed /
analyzed: gzhal bya la sogs pa'i sgra'i bsal bar bya ba med do zhes gang la rjod par byed /
translated: what is it that is expressed?

original: re zhig gal te dag la mi gnas pa 'ba' zhig pa tshig gzhan dang 'brel pa dang bral ba'i gzhal bya la sogs pa'i sgra la brten pa brjod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub ste /
analyzed: re zhig gal te dag la mi gnas pa 'ba' zhig pa tshig gzhan dang 'brel pa dang bral ba'i gzhal bya la sogs pa'i sgra la brten pa brjod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub ste /
translated: If it is said that the term “cognizable” and so on is based on a mere non-abiding, a term that is neither related to another term nor unrelated to another term, then that is proving what is already established,

original: don med pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig la sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig la sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is meaningless, since it is not applied to a mere non-abiding.

original: de ston pa ni /🔽rtog ldan rnams kyis glo bur du //
analyzed: de ston pa ni / rtog ldan rnams kyis glo bur du //
translated: To show that,

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni sgra gzhan dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni sgra gzhan dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: it is said:🔽“The term ‘cognizable’ and so on,🔽is applied to a mere non-abiding,🔽by the intelligent, suddenly,🔽in a different context.”🔽Here, “mere” means related to another term.

original: glo bur du zhes bya ba skabs las gzhan du'o //
analyzed: glo bur du zhes bya ba skabs las gzhan du'o //
translated: “Suddenly” means in a different context.

original: gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis sgra sbyor ba ni nyan pa po'i skye bo rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis sgra sbyor ba ni nyan pa po'i skye bo rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir yin gyi zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Because those who are endowed with thought apply words in order to take care of the person who is listening, not because of attachment.

original: 'ba' zhig la sbyar bas nyan pa po 'ba' zhig the tshom dang phyin ci log pa bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'dzin par byas par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig la sbyar bas nyan pa po 'ba' zhig the tshom dang phyin ci log pa bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'dzin par byas par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: If one applies words to the mere thing, one does not take care of the mere listener by way of the characteristic of averting his doubt and misconception.

original: 'di ltar gal te ston pa po nyan pa po de 'ba' zhig la the tshom dang phyin ci log gi blo skyes pa bzlog nas the tshom med pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te ston pa po nyan pa po de 'ba' zhig la the tshom dang phyin ci log gi blo skyes pa bzlog nas the tshom med pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i phyir yin na /
translated: If the teacher applies words to the mere thing in order to avert the doubt and misconception that have arisen in that listener, and in order to generate a non-doubting cognition,

original: de lta na des 'di rjes su gzung bar byas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na des 'di rjes su gzung bar byas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then he would take care of that listener.

original: gzhan @358b du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan @358b du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not of another.

original: 'ba' zhig la sbyar bas de ltar rjes su gzung bar nus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig la sbyar bas de ltar rjes su gzung bar nus pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And by applying to the mere thing, he is not able to take care of that listener in that way.

original: de lta bas na the tshom la sogs pa bzlog pa dang / nges pa skyed pa na nyan pa po rjes su gzung ba'i phyir sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa 'di dag la gnas pa nyid sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba ston pa na 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na the tshom la sogs pa bzlog pa dang / nges pa skyed pa na nyan pa po rjes su gzung ba'i phyir sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa 'di dag la gnas pa nyid sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba ston pa na 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate doubt, etc. and to generate certainty, one should apply the use of words that have results in order to take care of the listener. In order to teach this, he says, “However, etc.

original: the tshom dang ni yid gnyis so //
analyzed: the tshom dang ni yid gnyis so //
translated: Doubt and uncertainty.

original: la la zhig ces bya ba ni don la'o //
analyzed: la la zhig ces bya ba ni don la'o //
translated: “Someone” refers to the object.

original: de bzlog bya'i phyir zhes bya ba ni the tshom dang phyi ci log de dag bzlog pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de bzlog bya'i phyir zhes bya ba ni the tshom dang phyi ci log de dag bzlog pa'i don du'o //
translated: “In order to eliminate that” means in order to eliminate that doubt and uncertainty.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “By them” means by those who have conceptions.

original: des zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so//
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis so//
translated: “By that” means by the words “to be known,” etc.

original: ci ste ngag la gnas pa nyid //
analyzed: ci ste ngag la gnas pa nyid //
translated: “But if one applies the use of words, etc.”

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra'i dbang du byas nas brjod na /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra'i dbang du byas nas brjod na /
translated: If one applies the use of words, etc. in dependence on the words “to be known,” etc.

original: de ni ma grub po zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ni ma grub po zhes ston pa ni /
translated: “That is not established,” he says.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to teach this, he says, “In that regard,” etc.

original: de la ngag la gnas pa'i gzhal bya la sogs pa'i sgras /
analyzed: de la ngag la gnas pa'i gzhal bya la sogs pa'i sgras /
translated: In this regard, the words “the object of knowledge, etc.,”

original: blo gros blun po rnams te shes pa blun po rnams kyis dogs pa'i gnas su 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid bzlog pas de'i phyir gzhal bya la sogs pa'i sgra rnams la bzlog par bya ba med do zhes bya ba ni ma grub po //
analyzed: blo gros blun po rnams te shes pa blun po rnams kyis dogs pa'i gnas su 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid bzlog pas de'i phyir gzhal bya la sogs pa'i sgra rnams la bzlog par bya ba med do zhes bya ba ni ma grub po //
translated: are asserted to be the basis of doubt by those of foolish intellect, i.e., by those of foolish understanding. Since they are refuted, therefore, it is not the case that the words “the object of knowledge, etc.,” are without something to be refuted.

original: gzhan du na zhas bya ba ni gal te blo gros blun po rnams kyis dogs pa zlog par mi byed na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhas bya ba ni gal te blo gros blun po rnams kyis dogs pa zlog par mi byed na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Otherwise” means that if those of foolish understanding were not to refute doubt, that would be the meaning.

original: 'di snyam du nyan pa po la dogs pa cung zad kyang med do zhe na /🔽'di la cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du nyan pa po la dogs pa cung zad kyang med do zhe na / 'di la cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that the listener has no doubt at all,🔽he says, “If the listener, etc.”

original: gal te nyan pa po don 'ga' zhig la the tshom du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te nyan pa po don 'ga' zhig la the tshom du mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the listener would not have doubt about some matter,

original: de ci'i phyir gzhan gyis gdams pa la ltos par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir gzhan gyis gdams pa la ltos par 'gyur /
translated: why would he rely on the advice of another?

original: gzhan nges pa don du gnyer ba 'dri bar byed kyi gzhan du na bsnyon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nges pa don du gnyer ba 'dri bar byed kyi gzhan du na bsnyon par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is seeking certainty from another asks a question; otherwise, he would be deceived.

original: gal te 'di snyam du nyan pa po'i dogs pa'i gnas yod pa de lta na yang de sgras zlog par mi byed do snyam na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du nyan pa po'i dogs pa'i gnas yod pa de lta na yang de sgras zlog par mi byed do snyam na /
translated: then it is said:

original: ji ltar rang bzhin du gnas blo //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin du gnas blo //
translated: “The mind that is naturally settled”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: de ste nyan pa po'i mi shes pa la sogs pa zlog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'du byed do //
analyzed: de ste nyan pa po'i mi shes pa la sogs pa zlog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'du byed do //
translated: If there is a compositional factor that has the characteristic of refuting the hearer’s ignorance and so on,

original: ngag gang la de'i 'du byed yod pa ma yin pas de nyid 'du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gang la de'i 'du byed yod pa ma yin pas de nyid 'du mi byed pa'o //
translated: then that very [word] is not a compositional factor because it does not have that compositional factor.

original: brjod ces bya ba ni ston pa po'o //
analyzed: brjod ces bya ba ni ston pa po'o //
translated: “Expression” refers to the speaker.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin du gnas blo //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin du gnas blo //
translated: “The mind that is naturally settled”

original: zhes bya ba ni bsnyon pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsnyon pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that it would be a contradiction,

original: sgra rnams ni nyan pa po 'du byed pa'i don du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra rnams ni nyan pa po 'du byed pa'i don du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the words are applied for the purpose of composing the hearer.

original: ci ste ngag gang la gang zhig bzlog par bya ba blo gros ma nges pa'i dogs pa'i gnas gang zhig yin zhes dogs pa la /🔽gzugs sogs @359a * //
analyzed: ci ste ngag gang la gang zhig bzlog par bya ba blo gros ma nges pa'i dogs pa'i gnas gang zhig yin zhes dogs pa la / gzugs sogs @359a * //
translated: If you wonder, “In which speech is what to be refuted? What is the point of doubt of the uncertain mind?”🔽then it is said:🔽“Form and so on”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dis so //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dis so //
translated: “By that” means by the statement, “Form is that which is to be known by eye-consciousness.”

original: 'du bya ba de med pa ni 'du byed pa gang la yod pa'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'du bya ba de med pa ni 'du byed pa gang la yod pa'i 'du byed do //
translated: “That which is devoid of that activity” is that which has activity in regard to that activity.

original: brjod nyid ces bya ba'i sgrub pa po tha mal pa'i blo can ji ltar zhes bya ba bsnyon pa nyid du 'gyur bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod nyid ces bya ba'i sgrub pa po tha mal pa'i blo can ji ltar zhes bya ba bsnyon pa nyid du 'gyur bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Just the expression” is the proof. The ordinary person’s mind is the object of refutation. The meaning is that it is made into the object of refutation.

original: slob ma 'du byed pa kho na'i sgra rnams sbyar ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob ma 'du byed pa kho na'i sgra rnams sbyar ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The student applies the term “activity” alone.

original: 'on te gang la rmongs pa'i blo can yid gnyis kyi gnas yin pas sel ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang la rmongs pa'i blo can yid gnyis kyi gnas yin pas sel ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is the object of refutation because it is the object of doubt of the deluded mind, what is that object of refutation?

original: shes pa'i shes byar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa'i shes byar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “The object of consciousness,” etc.

original: des ni zhes bya ba mig gi rnam par shes pa'i shes par bya ba ni gzugs yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dis so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba mig gi rnam par shes pa'i shes par bya ba ni gzugs yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dis so //
translated: “By that” means by the statement, “The object of eye-consciousness is form.”

original: de la ji ltar sgro btags pa de la gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar sgro btags pa de la gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that is superimposed there?

original: mig la brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mig la brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The cognition that is based on the eye, etc.🔽The cognition that is based on the ear is permanent, and it is to be cognized as the entity of blue, etc.

original: rna ba la brten pa'i shes pa rtag pas sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor rig par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu grangs can la sogs pa'i blo gros rmongs pas sgro btags pa gang yin pa de gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes🔽pa'i shes par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dis 'gegs pa yin no //
analyzed: rna ba la brten pa'i shes pa rtag pas sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor rig par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu grangs can la sogs pa'i blo gros rmongs pas sgro btags pa gang yin pa de gzugs ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i shes par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag 'dis 'gegs pa yin no //
translated: This statement refutes the superimposition of the Samkhyas and others, who are confused in their intellect.

original: gzugs ni mig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs ni mig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of the statement “Form is to be cognized by the cognition of the eye” is that form is to be cognized by the cognition that is based on the eye.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not to be cognized by the cognition of the ear, etc.

original: de bzhin du ci chos thams cad skad cig ma dang bdag med pa'i ngo bor shes par bya'am 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du ci chos thams cad skad cig ma dang bdag med pa'i ngo bor shes par bya'am 'on te ma yin /
translated: Similarly, should all phenomena be cognized as having the nature of being momentary and selfless? Or should they not?

original: ci thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs kyis gzung bar bya ba'am 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: ci thams cad mkhyen pa'i thugs kyis gzung bar bya ba'am 'on te ma yin /
translated: Are they to be apprehended by the mind of the Omniscient One? Or should they not?

original: ci gang dag shes pa'ang mi skyed pa'i nye bar brjod pa thams cad bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa rnams kyang shes bya yin nam zhes the tshom du gyur pa la /
analyzed: ci gang dag shes pa'ang mi skyed pa'i nye bar brjod pa thams cad bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa rnams kyang shes bya yin nam zhes the tshom du gyur pa la /
translated: What? Are all things that are devoid of the characteristic of being a non-thing, which do not generate even the cognition of them, also objects of knowledge?🔽In response to this doubt, it is said:

original: chos thams cad ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo shes par bya la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo shes par bya la /
translated: “All phenomena are to be known as having the nature of being momentary, and so on.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis shes par bya ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis shes par bya ba yin zhing /
translated: Similarly, all phenomena are to be known by the wisdom of omniscience.

original: dngos po med pa rnams kyang shes par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa rnams kyang shes par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod do //
translated: And also non-things are to be known.”

original: de la chos rnams la skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa la sogs par shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bor sgro btags pa gang yin pa de la bzlog par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la chos rnams la skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa la sogs par shes bya nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bor sgro btags pa gang yin pa de la bzlog par bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, the superimposition that phenomena are not momentary, and so on, is to be refuted.

original: ji ltar de tshig tsam gyis bzlog par nus she na /
analyzed: ji ltar de tshig tsam gyis bzlog par nus she na /
translated: How can that be refuted merely by words?🔽In response to this, it is said:

original: de 'dra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos te /
analyzed: de 'dra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di smos te /
translated: “Such and such” and so on.

original: de 'dra'i zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bos te /
analyzed: de 'dra'i zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bos te /
translated: “Such” refers to the nature of momentariness, etc.

original: de ni tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is established by a valid cognition.

original: ci ste dngos @359b po med par shes bya nyid du ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci ste dngos @359b po med par shes bya nyid du ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: But how is a non-existent object established as an object of knowledge?

original: med pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Even non-existence,” etc.

original: bdag nyid 'di yis zhes bya ba ni med pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'di yis zhes bya ba ni med pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: “By this very nature” means by the nature of non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa rnams kyang ci zhig ltar blos rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir shes bya nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa rnams kyang ci zhig ltar blos rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir shes bya nyid yin te /
translated: Even non-existent objects are objects of knowledge because they are posited by the mind in some way.

original: de lta ma yin na de la tha snyad nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de la tha snyad nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, they would not even be conventionally existent.

original: 'on te ci sgra rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyis gzhal bya yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te ci sgra rnams mi rtag pa nyid kyis gzhal bya yin nam /
translated: But are sounds objects of knowledge because of impermanence?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba'i skabs su gzhal bya zhes sbyor ba na /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba'i skabs su gzhal bya zhes sbyor ba na /
translated: Or are they not?

original: de la skabs mi shes pa gang yin pa rtog pa po de yang gzhal bya 'ba' zhig pa'i sgra thos pa las sgra la sogs pa dag la yid gnyis dang bcas pa'i ngo bo'i blo nye bar skye ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la skabs mi shes pa gang yin pa rtog pa po de yang gzhal bya 'ba' zhig pa'i sgra thos pa las sgra la sogs pa dag la yid gnyis dang bcas pa'i ngo bo'i blo nye bar skye ba nyid yin la /
translated: In this regard, the one who is confused about the context, the thinker, also generates a mind that is uncertain about sound and so on, due to hearing the mere sound of the word.

original: de gal te 'ba' zhig pa'i sgra don med pa nyid yin na de ji ltar don rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / de ltar dag la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de gal te 'ba' zhig pa'i sgra don med pa nyid yin na de ji ltar don rtogs par 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir / de ltar dag la gnas pa'o //
translated: If the mere sound of the word is meaningless, how can the meaning be understood?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “In that way, it abides in that way.”

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: 'ba' zhig pa'i sgra thos pa las don rtogs pa nyid ni ma yin gyi //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa'i sgra thos pa las don rtogs pa nyid ni ma yin gyi //
translated: The meaning is not understood from hearing the mere sound of the word.

original: 'on kyang dag dag la dmigs pa'i don dang ldan pa'i sgra ni 'dra bas blo 'khrul pa 'ba' zhig pa'i sgra thos pa las don rtogs par rlom pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dag dag la dmigs pa'i don dang ldan pa'i sgra ni 'dra bas blo 'khrul pa 'ba' zhig pa'i sgra thos pa las don rtogs par rlom pa yin te /
translated: However, the sound that possesses the meaning that is observed in that way is similar, and the mind is mistaken. It is merely from hearing the sound that the meaning is understood.

original: 'di ltar ngag gang dag la gzhal bya'i sgra dmigs pa'i nyan pa po'i don la blo de rab tu mi gnas pa yid gnyis kyis ngo bo nye bar skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ngag gang dag la gzhal bya'i sgra dmigs pa'i nyan pa po'i don la blo de rab tu mi gnas pa yid gnyis kyis ngo bo nye bar skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, in regard to those sentences whose meaning is not ascertained by the hearer, the mind arises with a double nature.

original: de yang bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de yang bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag la yang mtshungs te /
translated: And that is also the same in regard to the words pot, etc.

analyzed: nyan pa pos gzung bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible for the one who listens to apprehend it.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be apprehended.

original: 'di ltar rang gi rnam par shes pa yod pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan nyan pa pos rtogs pa gang yin pa de 'chad pa pos rig pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi rnam par shes pa yod pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan nyan pa pos rtogs pa gang yin pa de 'chad pa pos rig pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the listener understands the reflection of the object that exists as his own consciousness, but the one who explains does not know it.

original: gang yang 'chad pa pos rig pa de ni nyan pa pos ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang 'chad pa pos rig pa de ni nyan pa pos ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the cognition of the expounder is not that of the hearer,

original: rang rang gi snang ba rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi snang ba rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each one has a cognition of his own appearance.

original: don med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is meaningless, he says,

original: brda'i dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brda'i dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “At the time of the convention,” etc.

original: 'chad pa po'am nyan pa po brda'i dus su gzugs brnyan nyams su myong ba de tha snyad kyi dus su nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'chad pa po'am nyan pa po brda'i dus su gzugs brnyan nyams su myong ba de tha snyad kyi dus su nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
translated: The experience of the reflection at the time of the convention by the expounder or the hearer is not the experience at the time of the conventional symbol,

original: de ni skad cig gis 'jig pa nyid kyi 'gags nas ring du lon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skad cig gis 'jig pa nyid kyi 'gags nas ring du lon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that has already ceased, having been destroyed by momentariness.

original: gang yang tha snyad kyi dus su nyams su myong ba de brda'i dus su mthong pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang tha snyad kyi dus su nyams su myong ba de brda'i dus su mthong pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is experienced at the time of the conventional symbol is not seen at the time of the convention,

original: de'i tshe na gzhan nyid nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na gzhan nyid nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time another is experienced.

original: gzhan du brda byas nas gzhan gyi tha snyad du byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du brda byas nas gzhan gyi tha snyad du byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to make a convention with one and designate another,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurdity.

original: rang dang rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rang dang rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed pa yin te /
translated: and “mine” and so on.

original: gang gis de la brda mi srid pa'i @363a * //
analyzed: gang gis de la brda mi srid pa'i @363a * //
translated: The fault of the impossibility of a sign is not incurred.

original: skyon gyis klan ka byed ba don dam par shes pa'i rnam pa yang sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba'i don nyid du 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon gyis klan ka byed ba don dam par shes pa'i rnam pa yang sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba'i don nyid du 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: The aspects of consciousness are not asserted to be the meaning of the words that express them, because

original: de'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad rang gi snang ba'i ngo bor rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba gnyis mthong ba bzhin du 'khrul bar 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad rang gi snang ba'i ngo bor rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba gnyis mthong ba bzhin du 'khrul bar 'dod de /
translated: therefore all these conventions that arise from words are asserted to be mistaken, like the two moons seen by someone with an eye disease.

original: don gyis stong pa'i brjod pa'i bag chags sad pa las sgra las don nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam skye ba kho nar zad pa'i phyir bskyed pas gzugs brnyan de bskyed pa'i phyir sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba yin no zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: don gyis stong pa'i brjod pa'i bag chags sad pa las sgra las don nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa tsam skye ba kho nar zad pa'i phyir bskyed pas gzugs brnyan de bskyed pa'i phyir sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba yin no zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Because the mere conceptual consciousness that ascertains the meaning from the word arises only from the activation of the latent tendencies for expression that are empty of meaning, the words are said to express the object that produces it, like a reflection.

original: brjod pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not said to express it by means of expression.

original: de la gal te yang 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dag gis don dam par rang rang gi snang ba rig pa de ltar yang rab rib can gnyis bzhin du 'khrul pa'i sa bon mtshungs pa'i phyir 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po de dag kyang phyi
analyzed: de la gal te yang 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dag gis don dam par rang rang gi snang ba rig pa de ltar yang rab rib can gnyis bzhin du 'khrul pa'i sa bon mtshungs pa'i phyir 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po de dag kyang phyi
translated: In this regard, if the expounder and the listener, in the ultimate sense, have the same cognition of their respective appearances, then, like the two people with eye disease, they are equal in terms of the seed of error.

original: rol gyi don zhen pa nyid du mtshungs so //
analyzed: rol gyi don zhen pa nyid du mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, the expounder and the listener are equal in terms of their attachment to external objects.

original: 'di ltar 'chad pa po 'di snyam du ngas rtog pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid 'dis rtogs so snyam du bsam pa 'dis 'jug la de bzhin du nyan pa po la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'chad pa po 'di snyam du ngas rtog pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid 'dis rtogs so snyam du bsam pa 'dis 'jug la de bzhin du nyan pa po la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, the expounder thinks, “Whatever object I imagine, he understands that very thing,” and he engages in that way. The listener should be applied in the same way.

original: ji ltar 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po 'di dag phan tshun du don gcig tu zhen pa nyid du shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po 'di dag phan tshun du don gcig tu zhen pa nyid du shes she na /
translated: How do we know that the expounder and the listener are equal in terms of their attachment to the same object?

original: ma yin te gal te don dam par mi shes pa de lta na yang 'khrul pa'i sa bon mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin te gal te don dam par mi shes pa de lta na yang 'khrul pa'i sa bon mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: No, if they do not know in the ultimate sense, in that case, they are equal in terms of the seed of error.

original: don dam par rang gi snang ba'i ngor byas nas kyang rab rib can gnyis bzhin du tha snyad 'di 'khrul pa nyid du yod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: don dam par rang gi snang ba'i ngor byas nas kyang rab rib can gnyis bzhin du tha snyad 'di 'khrul pa nyid du yod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: In terms of the ultimate, it has been taught that even from the perspective of one’s own appearances, like the two people with eye disease, this conventional reality exists as delusion.

original: des na don gcig tu zhen pa'i dbang gis brda byed par 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na don gcig tu zhen pa'i dbang gis brda byed par 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is tenable that the convention is made by the power of apprehending a single object.

original: 'dir dpe smras pa dper na rab rib kyis nyams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir dpe smras pa dper na rab rib kyis nyams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the example is stated: “For example, like the one with eye disease saying ‘There is a hair in my eye’ and so on.”

original: rang dang mtshun pas zhes bya ba ni bdag dang 'dra bas te /
analyzed: rang dang mtshun pas zhes bya ba ni bdag dang 'dra bas te /
translated: “Like oneself” means like the self.

original: rab rib can gzhan dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab rib can gzhan dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is “like another with eye disease.”

original: brda don med pa yang ma yin no zhes sto na pa ni /
analyzed: brda don med pa yang ma yin no zhes sto na pa ni /
translated: To explain that the meaning of the convention is not nonexistent, it says:

original: de'i khyab par byed pa 'di zhes bya ba ste brda dang tha snyad du phyin pa'i dus su khyab par byed pa nyid kyi 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po de dag gis nges pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan de zhen pa'i dbang gis 'dod kyi /
analyzed: de'i khyab par byed pa 'di zhes bya ba ste brda dang tha snyad du phyin pa'i dus su khyab par byed pa nyid kyi 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po de dag gis nges pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan de zhen pa'i dbang gis 'dod kyi /
translated: “This pervader” is the pervader at the time of engaging in the convention. The expounders and the listeners ascertain that reflected object by the power of apprehending it,

original: don dam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the ultimate.

original: tha snyad kyi dus su yang 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dag sngar dang phyis mthong ba'i don dag gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus su yang 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po dag sngar dang phyis mthong ba'i don dag gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the expounders and the listeners are attached to the identity of the things seen before and afterwards, even at the time of conventional usage.

original: yang cing phyir don dam pa nyid du mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang cing phyir don dam pa nyid du mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it not accepted as the ultimate?

original: sgra yis sprul pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgra yis sprul pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “because of the verbal expression,” and so on.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las sgra'i don brtag pa ste nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las sgra'i don brtag pa ste nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o /
translated: This concludes the investigation of the meaning of words in the Difficult Points of the Compendium of Reality, the twenty-first chapter.
